availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stephen W. Duval (McLean County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier.)

body.p: McLean County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, native. Married to Elizabeth Dorsett Duval in Henderson County, Kentucky, on October 31, 1865. Attended school in Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Laborer in McLean County, Kentucky, in 1860. Inmate of the McLean County Jail in 1860. Convicted of murdering George Johnson in McLean Circuit Court in 1860. Inmate of the Kentucky State Penitentiary at Frankfort, Kentucky, from November 24, 1860, to April 2, 1864. Pardoned by Governor Thomas E. Bramlette on April 2, 1864. Enlisted as a substitute for John E. Reno in Muhlenberg County on September 28, 1864. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 28, 1864, to May 3, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 2, p. 240A.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Hebbardsville, p. 68A.
“Duvall, Stephen,” Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0254.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Henderson County Marriages, Film 001944390.
Record of Prisoners, Kentucky State Penitentiary, Corrections Cabinet, Series 03615, KDLA, Volume: 1861-1866.
